Header: No Sri Lankan stranded in the US
Content: The Foreign Ministry stated that no Sri Lanka is stranded in John F Kennedy Airport due to the new immigration rules introduced by the Trump administration. Certain foreign media reported that 71 foreigners from 20 countries including Sri Lankans are stranded in John Kennedy Airport. In response to our enquiry with regard to the report, Foreign Ministry Media Spokesperson Maheshini Kolonne stated that no Sri Lankan is stranded in the airport as reported by such media. She also said that the Sri Lankan Embassy in New York could be reached on 0019175977009, if somebody wants further verification. The spokesperson also said that Sri Lanka is not among the countries for which America recently imposed immigration laws.
